oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A view of Nashville landscape and roads as seen from Reservoir Hill, 1928 April 08
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of Nashville landscape and roads as seen from Reservoir Hill, April 8, 1928. The reservoir structure itself is not pictured in this view, though some of the upper hill area is visible. The reservoir, located at 1401 8th Avenue South, was built between 1887 and 1889. The structure was constructed on top of Kirkpatrick Hill on the site of Fort Casino just south of downtown Nashville, Tennessee. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 snapshot : sepia ; 3.25 x 4 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Architecture; Capital City; Transportation; Reservoirs--Tennessee--Nashville; Roads--Tennessee--Nashville; Landscapes--Tennessee--Nashville
